Posts.Content: Aug 7, 2009 03:11PM asurvr wrote: Hi Yasminv1, I was diagnosed at 40 with IDC, Stage 1, grade 1.  How much things have changed in just little over 4 years :) I had to fight with my insurance company to have the Onoctype test as it was still considered in the preliminary stages back then.  Anyway, my score also put me in the higher end of possibly having a recurrence.  I had watched my father go through chemo and radiation when I was a child - I didn't want any part of that.  I did much soul searching and praying.  My decision was to go ahead and have the 4 AC's because then I could say I did what I could to keep it from coming back.  I continued to work and go to school while I was taking chemo - I would take off the day after my chemo (Friday) and give myself the weekend to rest.  I also pretty much just took off too at times (hey, sometimes you just need to).  Whether to take chemo or not is a very personal decision.  Whatever you decide know we will be thinking about you.  Have a blessed day, Barbara
Posts.Title: 31 yrs. Old Struggling to decide on Chemo yasminv1 yasminv1
